articles.headline: Forced Retirement Wastes Talent and Harms Economy
articles.summary: Age discrimination costs billions in lost productivity.
articles.content: AARP research shows mandatory retirement reduces GDP 2%. Experienced workers mentor effectively. Cognitive abilities remain strong with engagement. Age diversity improves decisions. Retirement should be individual choice.

articles.headline: Mandatory Retirement Opens Opportunities for Young Workers
articles.summary: Economist argues succession planning requires age limits.
articles.content: Youth unemployment correlates with delayed retirement. Innovation requires fresh perspectives. Cognitive decline affects decision-making. Succession planning needs predictability. Intergenerational fairness demands retirement.

articles.headline: Aging in Place Improves Health Outcomes 40%
articles.summary: Studies show home environment crucial for wellbeing.
articles.content: Gerontology research demonstrates better outcomes at home. Familiar environment reduces confusion. Family involvement improves care. Independence maintained longer. Cost-effectiveness superior to facilities.

articles.headline: Professional Elder Care Prevents 60% of Preventable Deaths
articles.summary: Medical supervision in facilities saves lives.
articles.content: Journal of Aging found facilities provide better medical monitoring. Falls prevented through professional care. Medication management superior in facilities. Social isolation reduced in communities. Families lack caregiving skills.

articles.headline: Aging Care Requires Personalized Solutions
articles.summary: Experts say individual needs should guide decisions.
articles.content: National Institute on Aging review shows varied needs. Health status determines appropriate setting. Family capacity varies significantly. Cultural preferences influence choices. Flexible continuum of care optimal.
